publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: when first the squire & Tinker wood
gravely consentting Irland good
to geather mingled in a mass
smith dust & Copper lead & Brass
the mixture thus by Chimick art
united Close in Every part
in fillets rolled or cut in pieces
appeared like one continued species
and by the forming engine struck
on all the same impression stuck
soe to confound the hated Coin
all partys & religions Join
whigs Tories Trimmers hannoveriens
Quakers conformist presbeterians
scatch Irish Inglish french unite
with equall interest Equall spight
together mingled in a lump
doe all in one opinione jump
and Every one begins to find
the same impressione one his mind
a strange Event when gold incites
to bood & quarrells Brass unites
for goldsmith say the Coarsest stuff
will serve for sodder well Enought
soe by the kitles laud a larme
the bees are gathered to a swarm
so by the Brasen trumpets Blusters
Trapes of all tongues & nations muster
and so the harp of jrland brings
whole crouds about its Brason stringes
There is a chain let down from Jove
but fastned to his throne aboue
soe strang that from the lower end
they Lay all human things depend
this chain as ancient poets hold
when jove was young was made of gold
prometheus once this chain purloined
disolved & into mony coined
then whipt mee on a Chain of Brass
Venus was bribed to let it pass
now while this Brazen chain prevailled
Jove saw that all devotion failled
no Temple to his godshipe Raised
no sacrifice an alters blazed
in short such dire confusions followed
Earth must have been in C overihaos swallowed
jove stood amazed but Looking round
with much a doe the Cheat he found
twas plaine he cauld no longer hold
the world in any chain but gold
& to ye god of wealth his his brother
sent mercury to get another
prometheus on a rock is laid
tyed with the Chain himself has made
an icy Cascasus to shiver
while vltures Eat his growing liver
Ye powers of grubstreet make me able
discretly to apply this fable
say who is to be understood
by that old thief prometheus wood
for jove it is not hard to guess him
j mean his m god bless him
this thief & Blacksmith was so bold
he strove to steal that Chain of gold
which links the subiect to the king
& chainge it for a Brazen string
but sure if nothing Elce must pass
between the king & us but Brass
altho the chain will nev overaer Crack
yet our devotione may grow slack
but jove will sown Convert j hope
this Brazen Chain into a rope
with which prometheus shall be tyed
& high in air for ever ride
where if wee find his liver grows
for want of Vultures wee have Crows344-269R
